publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3789 Shiona Baird: Project StarSight—That the Parliament commends the Dundee-based Abertay Centre for the Environment and its partner, Fife-based Compliance Technology, on their joint participation in the innovative project StarSight which will see the installation of solar-powered street lighting, incorporating wireless internet access, on the Abertay University campus in Dundee; notes the significant environmental benefits of these “smart” lights which operate by way of light-emitting diode technology developed in Singapore and which use a low amount of power derived from solar cells and recharged by daylight; further notes the additional benefits to communities of enjoying reliable, economic street lighting, coupled with easily accessible internet access; believes that potential worldwide sales related to the project StarSight pilot underline the importance of investment in the renewables industry; welcomes the showcasing of this innovative photovoltaic technology in Scotland, and wishes the project every success. Supported by: Brian Adam*, Mark Ballard*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-3789 Project StarSight (lodged on 9 January 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr David Davidson*, Mike Pringle*, Donald Gorrie*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-3789 Project StarSight (lodged on 9 January 2006) Frances Curran*, Kate Maclean*
S2M-3789 Project StarSight (lodged on 9 January 2006) Chris Ballance*
